title: Mafia 3 Review - Kinda Funny Gamescast Ep. 90 (Pt. 1)
description:
Colin gives his thoughts on Mafia 3.
Thanks to Dollar Shave Club for sponsoring this episode. Go to http://www.dollarshaveclub.com/gamescast

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

"Excited for Montreal, how is it going to pan out? It's okay, goddamn. We talked about it on PS I love you, but for those who are here, I mean obviously happy to talk about it again. I think that Mafia III's presentation in terms of its story, its voice acting, its characters and character development - I think it's fantastic. I think that they really nailed that. I think there's a lot of compelling characters. For those who don't know, it does take place in the same world as Mafia II. Vito Scaletta is actually one of your associates in Mafia III. The game takes place in 1968 and a place called New Bordeaux, which is a fictional version of New Orleans. And it's you play as a black man named Lincoln Clay. That's important because the Deep South is incredibly racist, especially in the 1960s. He comes back from Vietnam; he's a decorated soldier. He's also a special ops kind of guy, so he has a lot of special training and stuff like that."
